contexts.context: ...In the case of documents which have become <mark>yellow</mark> with age, improved results can often be...
...can often be obtained by printing through a <mark>yellow</mark> glass such as the Wratten No. 12...
...the original negative is made by printing in <mark>yellow</mark> light rather than white light. For this...
...is likely to bring about a discoloration or <mark>yellowing</mark> in papers on aging. There is general...
...more legible and attractive if run on a <mark>yellow</mark>-ivory paper. A reader choosing between typescript and...
...to be dermaprinted was selected because it was <mark>yellowed</mark> with age and contained a line cut....
